76#define AM_HAL_GPIO_BIT(n) (((uint64_t) 0x1) << n) /* DEPRECATED, PLEASE USE AM_HAL_GPIO_MASKBIT() */
77
85
86#define AM_HAL_GPIO_MASKCREATE(sMaskNm) volatile uint64_t p##sMaskNm=0
91
92// Implented as an inline function below.
93#define AM_HAL_GPIO_MASKBIT(psMaskNm, n) psMaskNm = (((uint64_t) 0x1) << n)
104
105#define AM_HAL_GPIO_MASKBITSMULT(psMaskNm, n) psMaskNm |= (((uint64_t) 0x1) << n)
109
110#define AM_HAL_GPIO_MASKCLR(psMaskNm)

131typedef struct // Future use - not currently used for Apollo3.
132{
133 union
134 {
135 volatile uint32_t Msk[AM_HAL_GPIO_NUMWORDS];
136
137 struct
138 {
139 volatile uint32_t b0: 1;
140 volatile uint32_t b1: 1;
141 volatile uint32_t b2: 1;
142 volatile uint32_t b3: 1;
143 volatile uint32_t b4: 1;
144 volatile uint32_t b5: 1;
145 volatile uint32_t b6: 1;
146 volatile uint32_t b7: 1;
147 volatile uint32_t b8: 1;
148 volatile uint32_t b9: 1;
149 volatile uint32_t b10: 1;
150 volatile uint32_t b11: 1;
151 volatile uint32_t b12: 1;
152 volatile uint32_t b13: 1;
153 volatile uint32_t b14: 1;
154 volatile uint32_t b15: 1;
155 volatile uint32_t b16: 1;
156 volatile uint32_t b17: 1;
157 volatile uint32_t b18: 1;
158 volatile uint32_t b19: 1;
159 volatile uint32_t b20: 1;
160 volatile uint32_t b21: 1;
161 volatile uint32_t b22: 1;
162 volatile uint32_t b23: 1;
163 volatile uint32_t b24: 1;
164 volatile uint32_t b25: 1;
165 volatile uint32_t b26: 1;
166 volatile uint32_t b27: 1;
167 volatile uint32_t b28: 1;
168 volatile uint32_t b29: 1;
169 volatile uint32_t b30: 1;
170 volatile uint32_t b31: 1;
171 volatile uint32_t b32: 1;
172 volatile uint32_t b33: 1;

191 } U;
192} am_hal_gpio_mask_t;

322typedef enum
323{
324 // Bit1 of these values maps to GPIOCFG.INCFG (b0).
325 // Bit0 of these values maps to GPIOCFG.INTD (b3).
326 AM_HAL_GPIO_PIN_INTDIR_LO2HI = 0x0,
327 AM_HAL_GPIO_PIN_INTDIR_HI2LO = 0x1,
328 AM_HAL_GPIO_PIN_INTDIR_NONE = 0x2,
329 AM_HAL_GPIO_PIN_INTDIR_BOTH = 0x3
330} am_hal_gpio_intdir_e;

352
353//
354// Apollo3 usage of bits [7:6] of a PADREG field:
355// PULLUPs are available on pins: 0,1,5,6,8,9,25,27,39,40,42,43,48,49
356// RESERVED on pins: 2,4,7,10-24,26,28-35,38,44-47
357// VDD PWR on pins: 3, 36 (b7=0, b6=1)
358// VSS PWR on pins: 37,41 (b7=1, b6=0)
359//
360
377typedef struct
378{
379 uint32_t uFuncSel : 3;
380 uint32_t ePowerSw : 2;
381 uint32_t ePullup : 3;
382 uint32_t eDriveStrength : 2;
383 uint32_t eGPOutcfg : 2;
384 uint32_t eGPInput : 1;
385 uint32_t eIntDir : 2;
386 uint32_t eGPRdZero : 1;
387
388 //
394 //
395 uint32_t uIOMnum : 3;
396 uint32_t uNCE : 2;
397 uint32_t eCEpol : 1;
398
399 uint32_t uRsvd22 : 10;
400
402
403} am_hal_gpio_pincfg_t;
404
405#define IOMNUM_MSPI 6
406#define IOMNUM_MAX IOMNUM_MSPI
407
408//
410// - C bitfields do not provide shift, width, or mask values.
411// - Shift values are generally compiler specific. However for IAR, Keil, and
412// GCC, the bitfields are all exactly as defined in the above structure.
413// - These defines should be used sparingly.
414//
415#define UFUNCSEL_S 0
416#define EPOWERSW_S 3
417#define EPULLUP_S 5
418#define EDRVSTR_S 8
419#define EGPOUTCFG_S 10
420#define EGPINPUT_S 12
421#define EINTDIR_S 13
422#define UIOMNUM_S 16
423#define UNCE_S 19
424#define ECEPOL_S 21
425
426#define UFUNCSEL_W 3
427#define EPOWERSW_W 2
428#define EPULLUP_W 3
429#define EDRVSTR_W 2
430#define EGPOUTCFG_W 2
431#define EGPINPUT_W 1
432#define EINTDIR_W 2
433#define UIOMNUM_W 3
434#define UNCE_W 2
435#define ECEPOL_W 1
436
440enum am_hal_gpio_pincfgerr
441{
442 AM_HAL_GPIO_ERR_PULLUP = (AM_HAL_STATUS_MODULE_SPECIFIC_START + 0x100),
443 AM_HAL_GPIO_ERR_PULLDOWN,
444 AM_HAL_GPIO_ERR_PWRSW,
445 AM_HAL_GPIO_ERR_INVCE,
446 AM_HAL_GPIO_ERR_INVCEPIN,
447 AM_HAL_GPIO_ERR_PULLUPENUM
448};

795//*****************************************************************************
796#define am_hal_gpio_input_read(n) ( \
797 (AM_REGVAL( (AM_REGADDR(GPIO, RDA) + (((uint32_t)(n) & 0x20) >> 3)) ) >> /* Read appropriate register */ \
798 ((uint32_t)(n) & 0x1F) ) & /* Shift by appropriate number of bits */ \
799 ((uint32_t)0x1) ) /* Mask out the LSB */
800
801#define am_hal_gpio_output_read(n) ( \
802 (AM_REGVAL( (AM_REGADDR(GPIO, WTA) + (((uint32_t)(n) & 0x20) >> 3)) ) >> /* Read appropriate register */ \
803 ((uint32_t)(n) & 0x1F) ) & /* Shift by appropriate number of bits */ \
804 ((uint32_t)0x1) ) /* Mask out the LSB */
805
806#define am_hal_gpio_enable_read(n) ( \
807 (AM_REGVAL( (AM_REGADDR(GPIO, ENA) + (((uint32_t)(n) & 0x20) >> 3)) ) >> /* Read appropriate register */ \
808 ((uint32_t)(n) & 0x1F) ) & /* Shift by appropriate number of bits */ \
809 ((uint32_t)0x1) ) /* Mask out the LSB */
810
811
812//*****************************************************************************
813//
837//*****************************************************************************
838//
839// Note - these macros use byte-oriented addressing.
840//
841#define am_hal_gpio_output_clear(n) \
842 ((*((volatile uint32_t *) \
843 ((AM_REGADDR(GPIO, WTCA) + (((uint32_t)(n) & 0x20) >> 3))))) = \
844 ((uint32_t) 0x1 << ((uint32_t)(n) % 32)))
845
846#define am_hal_gpio_output_set(n) \
847 ((*((volatile uint32_t *) \
848 ((AM_REGADDR(GPIO, WTSA) + (((uint32_t)(n) & 0x20) >> 3))))) = \
849 ((uint32_t) 0x1 << ((uint32_t)(n) % 32)))
850
851#define am_hal_gpio_output_toggle(n) \
852 if ( 1 ) \
853 { \
854 AM_CRITICAL_BEGIN \
855 ((*((volatile uint32_t *) \
856 ((AM_REGADDR(GPIO, WTA) + (((uint32_t)(n) & 0x20) >> 3))))) ^= \
857 ((uint32_t) 0x1 << ((uint32_t)(n) % 32))); \
858 AM_CRITICAL_END \
859 }
860
861#define am_hal_gpio_output_tristate_disable(n) \
862 ((*((volatile uint32_t *) \
863 ((AM_REGADDR(GPIO, ENCA) + (((uint32_t)(n) & 0x20) >> 3))))) = \
864 ((uint32_t) 0x1 << ((uint32_t)(n) % 32)))
865
866#define am_hal_gpio_output_tristate_enable(n) \
867 ((*((volatile uint32_t *) \
868 ((AM_REGADDR(GPIO, ENSA) + (((uint32_t)(n) & 0x20) >> 3))))) = \
869 ((uint32_t) 0x1 << ((uint32_t)(n) % 32)))
870
871#define am_hal_gpio_output_tristate_toggle(n) \
872 if ( 1 ) \
873 { \
874 AM_CRITICAL_BEGIN \
875 ((*((volatile uint32_t *) \
876 ((AM_REGADDR(GPIO, ENA) + (((uint32_t)(n) & 0x20) >> 3))))) ^= \
877 ((uint32_t) 0x1 << ((uint32_t)(n) % 32))); \
878 AM_CRITICAL_END \
879 }
880
881
882//*****************************************************************************
886//*****************************************************************************
887//
888// Define Fast GPIO enable and disable.
889//
890#define am_hal_gpio_fastgpio_enable(n) am_hal_gpio_output_tristate_enable(n)
891#define am_hal_gpio_fastgpio_disable(n) am_hal_gpio_output_tristate_disable(n)
892
893//
894// Macros for accessing Fast GPIO: set, clear, and read.
895// The 'n' parameter is the pin number.
896// Note - these macros are most efficient if 'n' is a constant value, and
897// of course when compiled with -O3.
898//
899#define am_hal_gpio_fastgpio_read(n) ((APBDMA->BBINPUT >> (n & 0x7)) & 0x1)
900#define am_hal_gpio_fastgpio_set(n) (APBDMA->BBSETCLEAR = _VAL2FLD(APBDMA_BBSETCLEAR_SET, (1 << (n & 0x7))))
901#define am_hal_gpio_fastgpio_clr(n) (APBDMA->BBSETCLEAR = _VAL2FLD(APBDMA_BBSETCLEAR_CLEAR, (1 << (n & 0x7))))
902#define am_hal_gpio_fastgpio_setmsk(m) (APBDMA->BBSETCLEAR = _VAL2FLD(APBDMA_BBSETCLEAR_SET, m))
903#define am_hal_gpio_fastgpio_clrmsk(m) (APBDMA->BBSETCLEAR = _VAL2FLD(APBDMA_BBSETCLEAR_CLEAR, m))
904#define am_hal_gpio_fastgpio_wrval(val) (APBDMA->BBSETCLEAR = \
905 (_VAL2FLD(APBDMA_BBSETCLEAR_SET, val) | \
906 _VAL2FLD(APBDMA_BBSETCLEAR_CLEAR, val ^ 0xFF)))
907
908
909#ifdef __cplusplus
910}
911#endif
912
913#endif // AM_HAL_GPIO_H
